page.title: 19BECKINGHAM TRAINING CAMP
page.content: This military training camp was built in 1941.Its purpose is to train people who want to become soldiers.They train the army cadet force, the combined cadet force, the territorials and the regular army.500 troops can stay at the camp at once.The troops normally get up at about 6:00 am but they don't always go to bed if on night exercises.The troops being trained can be between 17 and 50 years old. Sometimes they go on survival courses. They eat fresh rations and compo rations. The soldiers train from 1_2 weeks to a month at the camp. The weapons they use are the 303 rifle and the L1A1 SLR.The troops use the range every day except Friday.Red flags or lamps are flown to warn people.The camp was used as a prison for a while in 1981,and to house police during the recent miners strike.
